00010 #if !defined(GEOGRAPHICLIB_ACCUMULATOR_HPP)
00011 #define GEOGRAPHICLIB_ACCUMULATOR_HPP \
00012   "$Id: 39476b3fc8d7c5abcc980a7f434bb132d24f53ef $"
00013 
00014 #include <GeographicLib/Constants.hpp>
00015 
00016 namespace GeographicLib {
00017 
00018   /**
00019    * \brief An accumulator for sums.
00020    *
00021    * This allow many numbers of floating point type \e T to be added together
00022    * with twice the normal precision.  Thus if \e T is double, the effective
00023    * precision of the sum is 106 bits or about 32 decimal places.  The core
00024    * idea is the error free transformation of a sum, D. E. Knuth, TAOCP, Vol 2,
00025    * 4.2.2, Theorem B.
00026    *
00027    * The implementation follows J. R. Shewchuk,
00028    * <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/PL00009321"> Adaptive Precision
00029    * Floating-Point Arithmetic and Fast Robust Geometric Predicates</a>,
00030    * Discrete & Computational Geometry 18(3) 305-363 (1997).
00031    *
00032    * Approximate timings (summing a vector<double>)
00033    * - double:               2ns
00034    * - Accumulator<double>: 23ns
00035    *
00036    * In the documentation of the member functions, \e sum stands for the value
00037    * currently held in the accumulator.
00038    **********************************************************************/
00039   template<typename T = Math::real>
00040   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT Accumulator {
00041   private:
00042     // _s + _t accumulates for the sum.
00043     T _s, _t;
00044     // Error free transformation of a sum.  Note that t can be the same as one
00045     // of the first two arguments.
00046     static inline T sum(T u, T v, T& t) {
00047       volatile T s = u + v;
00048       volatile T up = s - v;
00049       volatile T vpp = s - up;
00050       up -= u;
00051       vpp -= v;
00052       t = -(up + vpp);
00053       // u + v =       s      + t
00054       //       = round(u + v) + t
00055       return s;
00056     }
00057     // Same as sum, but requires abs(u) >= abs(v).  This isn't currently used.
00058     static inline T fastsum(T u, T v, T& t) {
00059       volatile T s = u + v;
00060       volatile T vp = s - u;
00061       t = v - vp;
00062       return s;
00063     }
00064     void Add(T y) throw() {
00065       // Here's Shewchuk's solution...
00066       T u;                      // hold exact sum as [s, t, u]
00067       y  = sum(y, _t,  u);      // Accumulate starting at least significant end
00068       _s = sum(y, _s, _t);
00069       // Start is _s, _t decreasing and non-adjacent.  Sum is now (s + t + u)
00070       // exactly with s, t, u non-adjacent and in decreasing order (except for
00071       // possible zeros).  The following code tries to normalize the result.
00072       // Ideally, we want _s = round(s+t+u) and _u = round(s+t+u - _s).  The
00073       // following does an approximate job (and maintains the decreasing
00074       // non-adjacent property).  Here are two "failures" using 3-bit floats:
00075       //
00076       // Case 1: _s is not equal to round(s+t+u) -- off by 1 ulp
00077       // [12, -1] - 8 -> [4, 0, -1] -> [4, -1] = 3 should be [3, 0] = 3
00078       //
00079       // Case 2: _s+_t is not as close to s+t+u as it shold be
00080       // [64, 5] + 4 -> [64, 8, 1] -> [64,  8] = 72 (off by 1)
00081       //                    should be [80, -7] = 73 (exact)
00082       //
00083       // "Fixing" these problems is probably not worth the expense.  The
00084       // representation inevitably leads to small errors in the accumulated
00085       // values.  The additional errors illustrated here amount to 1 ulp of the
00086       // less significant word during each addition to the Accumulator and an
00087       // additional possible error of 1 ulp in the reported sum.
00088       //
00089       // Incidentally, the "ideal" representation described above is not
00090       // canonical, because _s = round(_s + _t) may not be true.  For example,
00091       // with 3-bit floats:
00092       //
00093       // [128, 16] + 1 -> [160, -16] -- 160 = round(145).
00094       // But [160, 0] - 16 -> [128, 16] -- 128 = round(144).
00095       //
00096       if (_s == 0)              // This implies t == 0,
00097         _s = u;                 // so result is u
00098       else
00099         _t += u;                // otherwise just accumulate u to t.
00100     }
00101     T Sum(T y) const throw() {
00102       Accumulator a(*this);
00103       a.Add(y);
00104       return a._s;
00105     }
00106   public:
00107     /**
00108      * Construct from a \e T.  This is not declared explicit, so that you can
00109      * write <code>Accumulator<double> a = 5;</code>.
00110      *
00111      * @param[in] y set \e sum = \e y.
00112      **********************************************************************/
00113     Accumulator(T y = T(0)) throw() : _s(y), _t(0) {
00114       STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<T>::is_integer,
00115                     "Accumulator type is not floating point");
00116     }
00117     /**
00118      * Set the accumulator to a number.
00119      *
00120      * @param[in] y set \e sum = \e y.
00121      **********************************************************************/
00122     Accumulator& operator=(T y) throw() { _s = y; _t = 0; return *this; }
00123     /**
00124      * Return the value held in the accumulator.
00125      *
00126      * @return \e sum.
00127      **********************************************************************/
00128     T operator()() const throw() { return _s; }
00129     /**
00130      * Return the result of adding a number to \e sum (but don't change \e sum).
00131      *
00132      * @param[in] y the number to be added to the sum.
00133      * @return \e sum + \e y.
00134      **********************************************************************/
00135     T operator()(T y) const throw() { return Sum(y); }
00136     /**
00137      * Add a number to the accumulator.
00138      *
00139      * @param[in] y set \e sum += \e y.
00140      **********************************************************************/
00141     Accumulator& operator+=(T y) throw() { Add(y); return *this; }
00142     /**
00143      * Subtract a number from the accumulator.
00144      *
00145      * @param[in] y set \e sum -= \e y.
00146      **********************************************************************/
00147     Accumulator& operator-=(T y) throw() { Add(-y); return *this; }
00148     /**
00149      * Multiply accumulator by an integer.  To avoid loss of accuracy, use only
00150      * integers such that \e n * \e T is exactly representable as a \e T (i.e.,
00151      * +/- powers of two).  Use \e n = -1 to negate \e sum.
00152      *
00153      * @param[in] n set \e sum *= \e n.
00154      **********************************************************************/
00155     Accumulator& operator*=(int n) throw() { _s *= n; _t *= n; return *this; }
00156     /**
00157      * Test equality of an Accumulator with a number.
00158      **********************************************************************/
00159     bool operator==(T y) const throw() { return _s == y; }
00160     /**
00161      * Test inequality of an Accumulator with a number.
00162      **********************************************************************/
00163     bool operator!=(T y) const throw() { return _s != y; }
00164     /**
00165      * Less operator on an Accumulator and a number.
00166      **********************************************************************/
00167     bool operator<(T y) const throw() { return _s < y; }
00168     /**
00169      * Less or equal operator on an Accumulator and a number.
00170      **********************************************************************/
00171     bool operator<=(T y) const throw() { return _s <= y; }
00172     /**
00173      * Greater operator on an Accumulator and a number.
00174      **********************************************************************/
00175     bool operator>(T y) const throw() { return _s > y; }
00176     /**
00177      * Greater or equal operator on an Accumulator and a number.
00178      **********************************************************************/
00179     bool operator>=(T y) const throw() { return _s >= y; }
00180   };
00181 
00182 } // namespace GeographicLib
00183 
00184 #endif  // GEOGRAPHICLIB_ACCUMULATOR_HPP
